title: Design Thinking-Based Flipped Learning for Medical Education Innovation

context.prior_knowledge: Knowledge of basic medical terminology and human anatomy, with experience using online learning platforms
context.additional_context: Applying innovative pedagogical approaches for solving complex clinical problems in hybrid education environments in the post-pandemic era

learning_goals: Learners can complete a clinical case analysis project by applying the five-stage design thinking process (Empathize-Define-Ideate-Prototype-Test).
Learners can build real-time feedback systems with team members using digital collaboration tools in flipped learning environments.
Learners can demonstrate patient-centered problem-solving approaches through case studies on respiratory/reproductive systems.
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
